column4: If 'sudo Xorg -configure' fails to generate a Xorg config file that works at all, are there any other utilities I can try to find a config that works?
If you use ATI drivers, there's always aticonfig.
I'm just trying to get Xorg to run on the livecd... I have a radeon x800gt though, so aticonfig should be useful
you have to install the ATI  proprietary drivers, rather than the Ubuntu ati drivers, if you want to use aticonfig, though.
